data.title: Top notch authentic Lebanese restaurant
data.text: Stumble into Sitti by chance while visiting downtown Raleigh and couldn't have chosen a better restaurant.  Everything was perfect....the food, the wine, the ambience, service and management. The space is warm and inviting and there are two party rooms available for private functions.  Don't miss this restaurant if you are in the area.

data.title: A journey to the middle east without leaving Raleigh, Downtown.
data.text:
We chose one of the variety appetizer options and Lebanese beers and had a great meal.  Much of what they have to offer is difficult to pronounce, but our tastebuds didn't care how we pronounce the food, only how it taste and sensational is way too simple a description.  
The hummus is unlike any of the commercial brands, thick, rich and oh, so good.  And to make tasting really great is the fresh made pita. 
We keep coming back here which we cant say to many other restaurants as we like variety, but that is just what Sitti offers.

data.title: Great restaurant for a family gathering!
data.text:
I was planning a surprise birthday party for my husband for a group of 10 and turned to Trip Advisor for suggestions. The reviews for Sitti (the Lebanese word for *grandmother*) were outstanding and it appeared the restaurant efficiently handled larger groups. Trip Advisor's reviewers were spot on--again. 

The staffer who handled my reservation request was excellent. She made notes for our server that I would pay the meal's bill, which he handled with grace at the end of our meal (as others tried to grab the bill). We had three birthdays to celebrate, so she made note of that as well. I received a phone call the morning of our celebration to confirm the reservation and make certain that no members of our party had any food allergies. How thoughtful... 

The meal was excellent, as was the service. The menu was varied enough that there was something for everyone. Lamb and salmon were the two favorite choices of our group. I enjoyed the beef kabob, which was served on a bed of Basmati rice with almonds and garlic dipping sauce. Everyone also enjoyed the tiramisu, which the birthday boys and girl were treated to--complete with candles. 

Sitti was the perfect place to gather family to celebrate another victory--a birthday.

data.title: Fabulous!!!!!
data.text:
This is fabulous restaurant in downtown Raleigh is run by two families who immigrated to NC years ago from Lebanon.  The name, "Sitti", refers to the grandmothers - who, through their food and hospitality, keep families together, with love.  

The food is absolutely incredible!  I've had Lebanese before, and the closest I've had to this good was a restaurant in London, England.  This is THAT good!

We got the Chicken Artichoke Pizza, The Beef Kabob, and the Chicken Artichoke entree'.  It was all superb.  I had the entree', and can't wait to go back and order it again!  I don't know what kind of rice they serve, or how they cook it, but we all agreed it was so light and moist and delicious!

My only complaint was no fabulous chocolate dessert :(

There is on street parking, and a pay parking garage just down the street.  Easily accessible, and plenty of room inside for walkers and wheelchairs.

data.title: Excellent food and service
data.text:
This was a great place for a business dinner. We had a group of 12 and for most people this was our  first Lebanese Food Experience.  I have to say that service was very good.  About half of our group are vegetarians.  I would highly recommend it for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians.  The samplers provided 6 different items and all of them were delicious. They had 2 vegetarian and 1 non-vegetarian choices. Other people in our party had the Kabobs.  They offer about 6 or 7 different varieties both vegetarian and non-vegetarian.  They were very moist and favorable and plenty of food. We did not leave hungry.

We had an excellent experience. I would recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Large family gathering
data.text: The service was amazing. We were a large group of 16 people gathering for a family wedding. I was very impressed how friendly and helpful everyone was to us in both reserving the space and taking care of us for dinner. The food was good but not excellent. The decor was cool.

data.title: Never Disappoints!
data.text: Had a great lunch today at Sitti. As always it was AMAZING. Plus the fall menu came out, so we got sweet potato pita with our regular fresh, oven baked pita! YUM!!! I highly recommend for the atmosphere and the fabulous food.

data.title: Top
data.text: Great evening, the service was polite but not over the top like in many other american restaurants. I can highly recommand the sitti tasting

data.title: An Artful Lebanese Food Experience
data.text:
Sitti is one of the early reasons for the renaissance of Raleigh's downtown restaurant scene.  And, they have done it through Lebanese food.  A great menu selection of traditional as well as new middle eastern dishes.  Artful use of spices and textures to bring out the very best of tastes.  Baby peppers stuffed with goat cheese were our starters as well as well made, traditional falafel.  The orange and goat cheese salad was crisp and dressed just right with a combination of oil and spices.  We ordered curried chicken, juicy and flavorful as well a salmon fillet cooked perfectly and on a bed of fresh sautéed vegetables, all again perfectly seasoned with tasty middle east flavors.

The service was prompt and friendly with careful attention but never "hovering'.  Our server knew her dishes and did a great job guiding us to our selections.

The atmosphere is also great.  Can be a bit noisy with a full restaurant but certainly never to the point of having to yell during a normal conversation.  All-in-al was an excellent experience and a good evening out.

data.title: Excellent food!
data.text: Amazing food and great selection of wine and house-made drink specials.  Atmosphere is great and it is in a great location for parking and walking to other great downtown Raleigh locations.

data.title: Late Lunch
data.text: A very nice surprise to have middle eastern food in the South! We didn't want a really big meal so we just shared a couple appetizers. The hummus with lamb was very tasty, though the hummus was a little thicker than I'm used to. There were also two kinds of bread in the basket- one was traditional and the other was almost a little sweet. The surprise was the goat cheese stuffed peppers with a balsamic drizzle. It was very rich and delicious. We were a little late for lunch and as they emptied out, our service slowed down. Over all- a pleasant surprise!

data.title: Great Lebanese food
data.text: Love Sitti!  Great food.  Great service.  Good atmosphere.  The wait staff is great with suggesting items to try.  Everything was really good.

data.title: Delicious, pleasant lunch
data.text:
We have heard about Sitti for quite some time and today we tried it out and were not disappointed. Loved the atmosphere of the old restored building in downtown Raleigh with lots of Windows for a light and bright room. Our server, Cassidy was so friendly and made some good recommendations for us to try. 
We were served warm pita bread-- one plain and the other pumpkin, which was fabulous and there was a dip of evoo and herbs. My husband had the pita chicken salad and Sitti fries, very delicious he said. I chose the blackened shrimp wrap with avocado hummus that was served with a small, crisp salad. 

As we finished the manager came by and asked how the meal was and because it was our first visit gave us free desserts. We chose the baklava-- delicious! We will definitely go back again

data.title: Passion and Pride from the Levant
data.text: Having spent a lot of time in the Middle East I was thrilled to find such exceptional Lebanese food in Raleigh. Everything was very fresh and homemade, even the kibbeh! I tried most of the traditional Lebanese options, and was really impressed.  The babaganoug has just the right amount of smokiness, the yogurt for the kibbeh thick and tart. The menu also includes many modern takes on traditional cuisine. Fresh loaves of pita, steaming hot, and a glass of Lebanese wine rounded out the meal. My server (Laura) was very attentive and knew the menu well. The general manager (Anthony) even came by to make sure all was well.  Passion and respect for food are evident here!

data.title: Excellent Lebanese/Mediterranean Food
data.text: We stopped in here for lunch while we were in downtown Raleigh visiting the Captol building and the Governor's Mansion--and, it's in walking distance of both. Not only is the food quite good, but the service was friendly and outstanding. This place has a very comfortable vibe--trendy, but not overdone. They just kept bringing food out to us and it was delightful. They very easily accommodated my need to eat gluten free.

data.title: Worth Every Penny
data.text: I'll be upfront and say that I cannot afford Sitti every day, but whenever I go it is absolutely worth every penny for the price. Yesterday evening, I made a reservation for five for one of our friend's birthdays. The atmosphere is friendly yet professional, and with a taste of family tradition at its heart. Our waiter, Jarred, was the keystone of what made our evening a success. From beginning to end he was a delight to interact with, had ample knowledge of the menu and was thorough in answering questions as well as offering suggestions. Then there is the food. Do you ever take a bite of something and actually have to take a moment, sit back, and just let the taste offer a one-of-kind experience to your senses? That's the kind of food I'm talking about here. We had an assortment of cheese and cold dips for our appetizers with pita bread that was both traditional and fall inspired with with our wines. Perfection. Each of us chose a different main dish from lamb, to chicken, to my dish of tempeh. As a vegetarian, I can tell you that Sitti gets tempeh right 100%. I've been meatless for just about 10 years and this tempeh was the best I can ever recall having (and I've had some *really* awful tempeh in that time). For the meat eaters at the table, their reactions were similar to mine. Everyone was beyond pleased and we found ourselves swapping dishes where we could so everyone could get a taste. For desert, we split the sweet potato cheese cake with the baklava crust and the friend banana with raspberry sorbet. What a perfect way to end the evening. Last night was one of my most fun in memory and I will most certainly be returning to Sitti for my next special occasion!

data.title: Lebanese Food
data.text: Amazing Food!! Fresh & Tasty!! Great location, at the heart of downtown Raleigh. The service was great.

data.title: Good value, good meal
data.text: We had a business meal here and I was absolutely amazed how good the food was. It was great experience, friendly atmosphere and good service.  They were helpful to my colleagues who didn't know what to order, including me since it was my first time here.  Would like to go back there and will recommend to others.

data.title: Food good, atmosphere unbearable
data.text: This place was so loud that you couldn't carry on a conversation with anyone on the other side of the table.  It took the enjoyment out of an otherwise good meal.  They really need to put some sound dampening into the place.  It just got worse as the evening went on as everyone tried to speak louder to be heard,   Literally gave me a headache!

data.title: Love Sitti, always a treat.
data.text: My boyfriend and I tried this out over a year ago for a date night. We were only planning on having a glass of wine and trying several starters and ended up staying for dinner and eating everything in sight. We go back regularly, food is always delicious and warm, portions are sized very fairly for the price. It's a must try; one of our top 3 favorite restaurants in Raleigh.
